meta.title: Complete Data & Analytics Mathematics Masterclass - Statistics to Machine Learning
meta.description: The most comprehensive 2-year data science mathematics program. Master statistics, probability, linear algebra for ML, optimization, deep learning mathematics, Bayesian methods, causal inference, and cutting-edge analytics techniques. Build the mathematical foundation for AI and data science.
meta.level: Basic Math Knowledge to Advanced Data Science Mathematics
meta.certification: Data Science Mathematics Expert Certificate upon completion

program_overview.title: Complete Data & Analytics Mathematics Masterclass
program_overview.tagline: From Statistical Basics to Advanced AI Mathematics - Master the Math Behind Data Science
program_overview.description:
This intensive 2-year program provides complete mathematical foundations for data science, machine learning, and AI. Whether you're aspiring to be a data scientist, ML engineer, quantitative analyst, or AI researcher, this masterclass gives you the deep mathematical understanding needed for excellence.

You'll master statistical thinking, probability theory, linear algebra for ML, optimization methods, deep learning mathematics, Bayesian inference, causal analysis, and more. Learn not just formulas but the intuition behind algorithms. By completion, you'll understand the mathematics behind every major data science and ML technique.
what_makes_this_different: Specifically designed for data science applications
Real datasets and industry case studies
Covers both classical and modern techniques
Deep learning and AI mathematics included
Interview preparation for data science roles

learning_path.phase_1: Foundation (Months 1-6): Statistics, Probability, Linear Algebra Essentials
learning_path.phase_2: Core Analytics (Months 7-12): Statistical Inference, Regression, Classification, Clustering
learning_path.phase_3: Advanced ML Math (Months 13-18): Optimization, Deep Learning, Bayesian Methods
learning_path.phase_4: Cutting Edge (Months 19-24): Causal Inference, Time Series, Big Data, Research

phase_1_foundation.title: PHASE 1: Mathematical Foundations for Data Science (Months 1-6, Weeks 1-26)
phase_1_foundation.description: Build rock-solid foundations in statistics, probability, and linear algebra essential for data science.

week_1_2.title: Introduction to Statistical Thinking
topics: What is data science? The role of mathematics
Types of data: numerical, categorical, ordinal
Scales of measurement: nominal, ordinal, interval, ratio
Data collection methods and sampling techniques
Data quality: missing data, outliers, errors
week_1_2.practice: Analyze 20 real-world datasets for quality issues

week_3_4.title: Measures of Central Tendency and Spread
topics: Detecting outliers: IQR method, z-score method

week_5_6.title: Data Visualization and Graphical Analysis
topics: Bar charts and categorical data visualization
Pie charts: when to use and avoid
Misleading visualizations and how to spot them

week_7_8.title: Probability Fundamentals
week_7_8.practice: Solve 150 probability problems with data applications

month_3_4.title: Months 3-4: Probability Distributions & Linear Algebra Basics

week_13_14.title: Linear Algebra for Data Science - Vectors
topics: Change of basis for data transformation
week_13_14.practice: Complete 100 vector operations in data context

week_15_16.title: Linear Algebra for Data Science - Matrices
topics: Matrix rank and linear independence of features
Systems of linear equations in ML
week_15_16.practice: Solve 100 matrix problems with data applications

week_20_21.title: Confidence Intervals
topics: CI for variance and standard deviation
Sample size for desired margin of error

week_22_23.title: Hypothesis Testing Fundamentals
topics: Type I and Type II errors
Power of a test and effect size

week_26.title: Phase 1 Capstone Project
projects: Complete EDA and inference on real dataset

phase_2_frontend_mastery.title: PHASE 2: Core Analytics & Machine Learning Mathematics (Months 7-12, Weeks 27-52)
phase_2_frontend_mastery.description: Master regression, classification, clustering, and core machine learning mathematics.

week_27_28.title: Simple Linear Regression
topics: Confidence and prediction intervals for regression

week_40_41.title: Support Vector Machines
topics: Soft margin SVM and slack variables
week_40_41.practice: Train 50 SVM models with different kernels

phase_3_backend_engineering.title: PHASE 3: Advanced Analytics & Deep Learning (Months 13-18, Weeks 53-78)
phase_3_backend_engineering.description: Master Bayesian methods, deep learning, reinforcement learning, and advanced statistical techniques.

week_71_72.title: Time Series Analysis
topics: Time series components: trend, seasonality, noise

phase_4_advanced_production.title: PHASE 4: Big Data, Production Systems & Research (Months 19-24, Weeks 79-104)
phase_4_advanced_production.description: Master big data analytics, production ML systems, experimental design, and conduct original research.

week_104.title: Research & Career Development
week_104.assessment: FINAL COMPREHENSIVE EXAM - Complete Data Science Mathematics

projects_throughout_course: Phase 1: Statistical analysis dashboards, EDA tools, Probability simulators, PCA implementations
Phase 2: ML pipelines, Classification systems, Clustering tools, Neural networks from scratch
Phase 3: Bayesian models, Deep learning architectures, Time series forecasters, Causal analysis
Phase 4: Big data systems, A/B testing platforms, Production ML services, Research projects
skills_mastered: Statistics: Descriptive, Inferential, Bayesian, Frequentist, Nonparametric
Machine Learning: Supervised, Unsupervised, Semi-supervised, Reinforcement Learning
Deep Learning: CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, GANs, VAEs, GNNs
Optimization: Convex, Non-convex, Stochastic, Constrained, Multi-objective
Time Series: ARIMA, State Space, Deep Learning methods, Forecasting
Causal Inference: RCTs, Observational studies, Natural experiments, IV methods
Big Data: Spark, Streaming, Distributed ML, NoSQL analytics
Production: MLOps, Monitoring, A/B testing, Model deployment
Specialized: NLP, Computer Vision, RecSys, Spatial statistics

prerequisites.mathematics: High school algebra and basic statistics helpful
prerequisites.programming: Basic Python/R knowledge beneficial but not required
prerequisites.equipment: Computer with internet, cloud credits provided

who_is_this_for.aspiring_data_scientists: Those starting a data science career
